head.title: Metro Briefing | New Jersey: Trenton: State Tries To Limit Greenhouse Gases

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New Jersey: Trenton: State Tries To Limit Greenhouse Gases

body.head.byline: By TINA KELLEY; Compiled by John Sullivan

abstract.p: New Jersey Gov Jon S Corzine signs executive order to limit greenhouse gas emissions to 1990 levels by 2020; also requires lowering emissions to 80 percent below 2006 levels by 2050 (S)

block.p: Gov. Jon S. Corzine signed an executive order yesterday committing the state to reduce New Jersey's greenhouse gas emissions to 1990 levels by 2020. The order also requires lowering such emissions to 80 percent below 2006 levels by 2050. The State Department of Environmental Protection will monitor progress toward these goals, and in the next six months the director of energy savings in the Department of the Treasury is required to create targets and implementation strategies for reducing energy use by state agencies.

Gov. Jon S. Corzine signed an executive order yesterday committing the state to reduce New Jersey's greenhouse gas emissions to 1990 levels by 2020. The order also requires lowering such emissions to 80 percent below 2006 levels by 2050. The State Department of Environmental Protection will monitor progress toward these goals, and in the next six months the director of energy savings in the Department of the Treasury is required to create targets and implementation strategies for reducing energy use by state agencies.
